ncrsGatheringSites.abcd:LocalityText: GB.21: Egypt, Suez Canal, Great Bitter Lake, E-side, Sta.21; depth 1.5-3 m, slightly clayey sand, no vegetation; dredging; viii/ix.1950
BM.9121: France, Côtes-du-Nord, N of Le Val André, intertidal dike to Ile Verdelet; stones, sand and gravel; 20.iii.1991
CANCAP-III, Sta. 3.111: off Mauritania; 20°21'N 17°14'W; depth 30 m, shell sand with many small tellinids; Hamon grab; 27.x.1978
CANCAP-I, Sta. 1.071: Madeira archipelago, E of Madeira; 32°41'N 16°35'W; depth 120 m, shells and sand; van Veen grab; 14.iii.1976
CANCAP-VII, Sta. 7.030: Cape Verde Islands, SE of Cima; 14°57'N 24°39'W; depth 165 m, hard bottom with some yellow calcareous sand; van Veen grab; 23.viii.1986
CANCAP-IV, Sta. 4.059: Canary Islands, SE of Lanzarote; 28°48'N 13°45'W; depth 420-475 m, sandy bottom; 1.2 m Agassiz trawl; 19.v.1980
Sta. SE.6305: Norway, Stjörnfjord, N of Fevaag; 63°42'N 09°51'E; depth 50-35 m; dredged; 22.viii.1963
